title: Police identify Clarksville 4-year-old who shot himself
content:
CLARKSVILLE, Tenn. – Clarksville Police on Wednesday identified the 4-year-old they believe shot himself in the chest over the weekend.
The child is Eldin James Rogers, according to a news release from spokeswoman Officer Natalie Hall.
Eldin is the son of Jestin Dale Rogers and Rachel Hamilton Rogers, according to his obituary with Neal-Tarpley-Parchman Funeral Home.
The incident happened Sunday evening in the 2600 block of Arthurs Court. Eldin was transported via LifeFlight helicopter to Vanderbilt University Medical Center, where he died.
Neighbors said he lived at 2665 Arthurs Ct., and Hall confirmed that as his address Wednesday. Neighbors said the family had moved in about a month ago.
This is an ongoing investigation, and police were not able to release further information. Anyone with information on this case is urged to call Detective Eric Ewing, 931-648-0656 ext. 5447.
Eldin was born Dec. 2, 2009, in Cottonwood, Arizona.
In addition to his parents, Eldin is survived by maternal grandparents, Tim and Shannon Corcoran of Clarksville; his paternal grandparents, Robin and Gerald Rogers of Camp Verde, Arizona; and his brother, Bryson Dale Rogers of Clarksville, according to the obituary.
A memorial service will be held on Sunday, Aug. 24, at 2 p.m., at Neal-Tarpley-Parchman Funeral Home, 1510 Madison St., with Capt. Seung-il Suh officiating.
Chris Smith, 245-0282
Senior Editor
chrissmith@theleafchronicle.com
